Entries.default: The orrery controls are oiled and ready to be manipulated.
[Enter the coordinates for the Huntress legend constellations.]
[Leave.]
As the last number settles into place, you hear the sound of dormant gears beginning to turn. A low vibration builds under your feet.
[Read the plaque.]
Bekarna, If you're reading this, you've forgotten again. You blasted your mind to bits trying to scribe Bekarna's Clarity of Thought. I'm sorry.
[Manipulate the controls.]
You pull on levers and enter random numbers into the coordinates. When nothing happens, gears spin in the machine and reset the numbers to zero.
[Examine the controls more closely.]
The levers adjust a series of numbered dials which correspond to the altitude and azimuth of celestial bodies.
You enter the coordinates you've collected so far. Nothing happens.
The control mechanism of this orrery is tarnished, though recently oiled. Some of the levers show signs of meddling.
A plaque to the side bears the mark of a hand swiping to brush away dust.
The orrery has rotated into the correct position already.

Never doubt yourself. Your years of research were well-spent even if no one called you 'archmage' at the end of them. Even if they laughed. I know you remember the legend of your favorite Huana constellation, the Huntress.

When you need a little confidence, set the coordinates of the Huntress and the three stages of her tale into this orrery. You can do more with half a brain than most competent wizards. So get back to work.
"If I don't survive our adventures, promise me you'll burn all my books." He's blushing.
Whatever the mechanism is meant to do, it will only work with the right set of coordinates.
Three more coordinates are still required.
Two of the coordinates are missing.
One final set of coordinates is required.
Love, Bekarna
Four sets of coordinates can be entered at once, which will spin the inner mechanism of the globe in a precise combination of turns.
